SEARCH
Module com.example.paint1
Package com.example.paint1

Class ShapeMath

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas
com.example.paint1.ShapeMath
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class ShapeMath extends javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas
This class file is used to manage the features used to draw on the canvas or image and the features in the edit and movement tab of the menu bar. Includes the mouse interaction movements, calling each draw function button, menu bar functions, and undo/redo stacks

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ShapeMath(javafx.scene.control.Tab tab)
    This method constructs a ShapeMath object for a specified Tab, initializing a Canvas with default dimensions, setting up the graphics context, cursor, and scroll pane, and configuring various mouse event handlers for different drawing tools and features.

      public javafx.scene.image.Image imageSelection

  • Constructor Details

    • ShapeMath

      public ShapeMath(javafx.scene.control.Tab tab)
      This method constructs a ShapeMath object for a specified Tab, initializing a Canvas with default dimensions, setting up the graphics context, cursor, and scroll pane, and configuring various mouse event handlers for different drawing tools and features.
      Parameters:
      tab - to which the Canvas and associated drawing tools will be added.

    • addUndo

      public void addUndo(Stack<javafx.scene.image.Image> stack, javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas)
      Captures the current state of a Canvas by taking a snapshot and adds it to an Undo stack. This method is designed to work with JavaFX Canvas and a stack of Image objects to support undo functionality.
      Parameters:
      stack - the Undo stack where the snapshots of the Canvas state will be stored.
      canvas - the Canvas whose current state needs to be captured and added to the Undo stack.

      y1 - initial y

    • drawPolygon

      public void drawPolygon(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2, int s)
      Draws a polygon of s sides to the canvas with a center at x1, y1 and calculates radius with x2, y2.
      Parameters:
      x1 - x coordinate for center of polygon
      y1 - y coordinate for center of polygon
      x2 - x2 coordinate for
      y2 - y2 coordinate for
      s - s for desired sides on the polygon
